titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Stuart G. Cross, "Stanford and Yosemite" Typescript
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.unittitle: Stuart G. Cross, "Stanford and Yosemite" typescript
did.abstract: This article formed the basis of Cross's lecture during a Stanford Historical Society tour of Yosemite in May 1981. It relates the history of David Starr Jordan's interest in Yosemite, his friendship with David A. Curry, the history of Camp Curry, and the roles of Donald B. Tresidder (Stanford Univ. President 1943-48) and his wife Mary Curry Tresidder at Yosemite.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

acqinfo.p: Gift of Don and Corinne Carlson, 1998.

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Stuart G. Cross, "Stanford and Yosemite" Typescript (SCM0184). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Cross earned his B.A. (1947) and M.A. (1948) in history at Stanford University; for many years he was the manager of the Curry Company, operator of facilities at Yosemite National Park.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: This article formed the basis of Cross's lecture during a Stanford Historical Society tour of Yosemite in May 1981. It relates the history of David Starr Jordan's interest in Yosemite, his friendship with David A. Curry, the history of Camp Curry, and the roles of Donald B. Tresidder (Stanford Univ. President 1943-48) and his wife Mary Curry Tresidder at Yosemite.
